issue.title: [TT-506] - Self-Healing when hitting 16mb + making aggregation per time setting configurable
issue.body: ## Description When a document size hits 16Mb, we will create a new document with the current timestamp and reduce the aggregation per time configuration by half. Also, users can set an initial aggregation per time, using `analytics_stored_per_minute` in the .conf file, for example: **Default value is set to 60. The scope of the Jira Ticket is to fix this error when using Mongo Aggregate (it also supports Hybrid). SQL Aggregate should work as always and the idea is to make this change on it in another PR** **Use cases:** - If the user sets `analytics_stored_per_minute` = 40, Tyk-Pump will create an initial document on the first request, and will create another document when a new request is received and the current timestamp > last document timestamp + 40 minutes. - If the current document hits 16Mb before 40 minutes have passed, a new document will be created and now, `analytics_stored_per_minute` will equal 20. - If the current document hits 16Mb and `analytics_stored_per_minute` = 1, we can't reduce this setting, so the user will receive an error saying that it was unable to send the new data to the current document. - If `analytics_stored_per_minute` is an odd number, we will round down (i.e: 3 will be converted to 1, not 1.5 or 2) - Every time a document hits 16Mb and we heal it, we will fire an error log telling that there was a problem updating a document, and a warning log saying that we will try to fix it automatically. **Different Behaviors** - If 2 or more pumps are writing data into the same collection, and the collection hits 16Mb, all of them are changing their aggregation time when they try to write data. This is happening because, when they try to write data, they will receive an error. Then, they will check if the error is related to the size of the document. Finally, each pump will activate the self-healing mechanism. - SQL aggregate is working as always. - It is currently working with 3 types of Mongo DBs: Standard Mongo, CosmosDB, DocumentDB. ## Related Issue https://tyktech.atlassian.net/browse/TT-506 ## Motivation and Context It allows users to set an aggregation per time. It also avoids errors when hitting max document size. ## How This Has Been Tested Unit tests were created + manual testing using --demo flag to send multiple fake requests to APIs and send data to Redis to simulate the process. ## Screenshots (if appropriate) ## Types of changes - [x] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue) - [x] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality) - [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change) ## Checklist - [ ] Make sure you are requesting to **pull a topic/feature/bugfix branch** (right side). If pulling from your own fork, don't request your `master`! - [ ] Make sure you are making a pull request against the **`master` branch** (left side). Also, you should start *your branch* off *our latest `master`*. - [ ] My change requires a change to the documentation. - [ ] If you've changed APIs, describe what needs to be updated in the documentation. - [ ] I have updated the documentation accordingly. - [ ] Modules and vendor dependencies have been updated; run `go mod tidy && go mod vendor` - [ ] I have added tests to cover my changes. - [ ] All new and existing tests passed. - [ ] Check your code additions will not fail linting checks: - [ ] `go fmt -s` - [ ] `go vet`

issue.title: TT-3067 - Add ability to use ssl_insecure_skip_verify with Elasticsearch Pump
issue.body:
<!-- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

## Description
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->
Adding users the ability to use an insecure SSL (an autogenerated one), by skipping the SSL verification. We are also allowing the user to select cert and key files.
They can also set the option UseSSL to false in order to skip this process. 
## Related Issue
<!-- This project only accepts pull requests related to open issues -->
<!-- If suggesting a new feature or change, please discuss it in an issue first -->
<!-- If fixing a bug, there should be an issue describing it with steps to reproduce -->
<!-- Please link to the issue here -->
https://tyktech.atlassian.net/browse/TT-3067?atlOrigin=eyJpIjoiZDNjOTRkNTIxZmI0NDU3MDhlMWYzM2ZkYjQ1ZGZlZWYiLCJwIjoiaiJ9
## Motivation and Context
<!-- Why is this change required? What problem does it solve? -->

## How This Has Been Tested
<!-- Please describe in detail how you tested your changes -->
<!-- Include details of your testing environment, and the tests you ran to see how your change affects other areas of
the code, etc. -->
This has been tested by deploying a local Elastic Search with an autogenerated SSL certificate. I have also been using `--demo` flag in the pump to simulate requests.
[This is the tutorial I've used to deploy it with Docker.](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/7.17/configuring-tls-docker.html)

This is the exact command I ran to deploy pump:
`go build && TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_TYPE=elasticsearch TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_INDEXNAME=tyk_analytics TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_ELASTICSEARCHURL=https://localhost:9200 TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_ENABLESNIFFING=false TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_DOCUMENTTYPE=tyk_analytics TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_ROLLINGINDEX=false TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_EXTENDEDSTATISTICS=false TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_VERSION=7 TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_BULKCONFIG_WORKERS=2 TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_BULKCONFIG_FLUSHINTERVAL=60 TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_USESSL=true TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_SSLCERTFILE=/tmp/es01.crt TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_SSLKEYFILE=/tmp/es01.key TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_USERNAME=elastic TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_PASSWORD=password TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_SSLINSECURESKIPVERIFY=true
./tyk-pump --conf ../tyk-develop-env/confs/pump_elastic.conf --demo=634ed5f395014f77d8ec3e49 --demo-api=d79ecd1363784e6c7380cd58f8f44e8d
`

I also deployed an AWS ElasticSearch instance to test this feature using a valid certificate.

## Screenshots (if appropriate)

## Types of changes
<!-- What types of changes does your code introduce? Put an `x` in all the boxes that apply: -->
- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [x] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change)

issue.title: [TT-5744] OAS docs updates
issue.body:
The commit completes the work set out in TT-5744.

## Description
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->

- Improve the x-tyk-gateway schema docs generator to group together markdown content without excessive newlines. The paragraphs now stick together, and whitespace output is improved.
- Renamed `Old API definition` into `Tyk native API definition`
- Documented the complete apidef/oas package according to godoc rules, adding missing docs
- Fixed capitalization issues reported by the linter for the most part (Json/JSON, Http/HTTP, Api/API...)

## Related Issue
<!-- This project only accepts pull requests related to open issues -->
<!-- If suggesting a new feature or change, please discuss it in an issue first -->
<!-- If fixing a bug, there should be an issue describing it with steps to reproduce -->
<!-- Please link to the issue here -->

https://tyktech.atlassian.net/browse/TT-5744

## Motivation and Context
<!-- Why is this change required? What problem does it solve? -->

- OAS fields haven't been documented fully for our x-tyk-gateway schema docs,
- Other fields and types haven't been documented according to godoc specs.

## How This Has Been Tested
<!-- Please describe in detail how you tested your changes -->
<!-- Include details of your testing environment, and the tests you ran to see how your change affects other areas of
the code, etc. -->

I've ran this against a custom golangci-lint configuration to ensure that godoc comment patterns are followed. Each exported symbol must have a comment which starts with the symbol name. I've added a significant amount of comments to resolve all the reported godoc issues under apidef/oas.

Additionally, as there are a lot of comments changes/ docs changes to review, I used the following line to ensure I haven't removed anything else by accident - this ignores all the changed/added comments, and displays the remaining code changes for review:

```
git diff *.go | egrep -v '^[+-].*//' | colordiff | less -r
```

# How to review

1. The release target scope of the PR

As the changes are contained within apidef/oas, our minimum target release version is 4.2. Should we split the PR into multiple PRs, it's still going to be 4.2, we're only exaggerating with both splitting the PRs and the CI feedback loops, not to mention each PR increases code review feedback loops too.

2. Review area

What neeeds reviews is:

- code changes not releated to comments,
- documentation changes (generated docs),

**The code changes made are:**

- capitalization fixes for various fields for common acronyms (Http to HTTP and similar),
- made two fields non-public (used in tests),
- renamed a 'version' package into 'pkgver' to make it clearer we don't shadow the value over the package name,
- the improvements to the xtyk docs generator outlined above

To only view the code changes, check out the branch locally, go to `apidef/oas` and issue:

```
git diff -w HEAD~9 *.go | \
egrep -v '^[+-].*//' | \
egrep '^[+-]' | \
grep -v '^---' | grep -v '^+++' | \
perl -p -e 's/^([+-]).+/$1/g' | \
sort | uniq -c
```

This returns `+256` and `-162`. The changes are even smaller considering the capitalization fixes add up, but that too could be brought down with git difftool and case-insensitive diffs. The xdoc changes are `+96` and `-53` (change wildcard from `*.go` to `xtyk_*.go`. To view the differences themselves and not just the statistics for additions/removals, we have:

```
git diff -w HEAD~9 *.go | \
egrep -v '^[+-].*//' | \
grep -v '^+$' | \
colordiff | \
less -r
```

This will:

- diff only *.go files (not the .md generated one),
- ignore added or removed comments lines from the diff,
- ignore empty lines (added whitespace)
- print a colorized diff with colordiff
- invoke less to scroll through the changes

If there's an issue you want to raise up, this will give you the file/line information to do that.

**Documentation review**

As explained above, this PR mostly adds documentation. Rather than reviewing the code where the documentation is added, the final result from that should be reviewed. The documentation review should happen over the difference between these two outputs:

- New docs: https://github.com/TykTechnologies/tyk/blob/fix/tt-5744/improve-oas-docs-and-generator/apidef/oas/schema/x-tyk-gateway.md
- Existing docs: https://github.com/TykTechnologies/tyk/blob/master/apidef/oas/schema/x-tyk-gateway.md

There is little sense of reviewing the actual code `//` comments, what matters is the generated output, and if we need to change wording there (spell check, phrasing, etc.). The comments about formatting godoc comments have been addressed in the PR, and we try to keep consistency (Fill, ExtractTo, godoc comments should be full sentences).

The PR adds godoc comments where previously omitted. If required, grab the golangci-lint config from this link here: [private repo](https://github.com/TykTechnologies/titpetric/blob/main/dev/.golangci.yml) and run with `golangci-lint --enable-all run .` from the apidef/oas folder. This is how I verified we follow godoc standards, not by hand, but by tooling.

## Screenshots (if appropriate)

## Types of changes
<!-- What types of changes does your code introduce? Put an `x` in all the boxes that apply: -->
- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change)
- [x] Refactoring or add test (improvements in base code or adds test coverage to functionality)

## Checklist
<!-- Go over all the following points, and put an `x` in all the boxes that apply -->
<!-- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask; we're here to help! -->
- [ ] Make sure you are requesting to **pull a topic/feature/bugfix branch** (right side). If pulling from your own
      fork, don't request your `master`!
- [ ] Make sure you are making a pull request against the **`master` branch** (left side). Also, you should start
      *your branch* off *our latest `master`*.
- [ ] My change requires a change to the documentation.
  - [ ] If you've changed APIs, describe what needs to be updated in the documentation.
  - [ ] If new config option added, ensure that it can be set via ENV variable
- [ ] I have updated the documentation accordingly.
- [ ] Modules and vendor dependencies have been updated; run `go mod tidy && go mod vendor`
- [ ] When updating library version must provide reason/explanation for this update.
- [ ] I have added tests to cover my changes.
- [ ] All new and existing tests passed.
- [ ] Check your code additions will not fail linting checks:
  - [ ] `go fmt -s`
  - [ ] `go vet`

issue.title: [TT-6927] Improving DX with make lint, add faillint, PR template update
issue.body:
Essentially this PR improves a number of things in regards to the developer experience. There are a number of scenarios which hurt our delivery due to time wasted on CI and a very long feedback loop, and often actions which should be first-order development tasks before opening a PR.
<!-- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

## Description
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->

- Added `make lint`, updated CI to use it. People don't run shit on local, I hope this will change this.
- Added `goimports` and `gofmt` as part of `make lint` (make people run it on local)
- Added .faillint to blacklist `fmt.Print*` (use our /log pkg) and `net/http.Get` (no timeouts).
- Added goenv `.go-version`, we build against 1.16 - facilitate people actually using 1.16 with goenv.
- Updated PR template (removed unused/obsolete checklists) - most of them are handled in CI, we don't need to double-blind the inputs. I've left only the essential ones that apply.
- If a new field is added into the /config/config.go, usually a separate linter surfaces an issue in the CI. The linter is now added into `make lint`.
- Decreased verbosity on failing tests, scrolling through 100 pages of content has no value. This PR removes spam both in github comments and emails.

## Related Issue
<!-- This project only accepts pull requests related to open issues -->
<!-- If suggesting a new feature or change, please discuss it in an issue first -->
<!-- If fixing a bug, there should be an issue describing it with steps to reproduce -->
<!-- Please link to the issue here -->

As of yet - none. This falls under maintenance and CI, DX, and should only be merged to the develop branch, or particularly the latest release branch. Backporting it isn't required as it fixes no immediate issues, only improves ongoing development.

## Motivation and Context

Happyness.
<!-- Why is this change required? What problem does it solve? -->

## How This Has Been Tested

Lots of `make lint` invocations. GH actions have been left to CI.

<!-- Please describe in detail how you tested your changes -->
<!-- Include details of your testing environment, and the tests you ran to see how your change affects other areas of
the code, etc. -->

## Screenshots (if appropriate)

## Types of changes
<!-- What types of changes does your code introduce? Put an `x` in all the boxes that apply: -->
- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change)
- [x] Refactoring or add test (improvements in base code or adds test coverage to functionality)

## Checklist

- [x] I ensured that the documentation is up to date
- [x] I explained why this PR updates go.mod in detail with reasoning why it's required
- [x] I would like a code coverage CI quality gate exception and have explained why

This is a maintenance PR. There are no implementations added for which code coverage should be addressed. There are no go.mod changes.

issue.title: [TT-6575] feat: persisted queries
issue.body:
<!-- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

## Description
This PR adds a new middleware `PersistGraphQLOperationMiddleware` by @asoorm. This middleware allows the exposing graphql endpoints as Rest endpoints vie extended paths. It also allows using variables from the context variables, path or other tyk template variables. 
[Link to demo video](https://www.loom.com/share/684e1e9902054d978897e24d7824dec5)
Sample Spec:
```.json
"extended_paths": {
          "persist_graphql": [
            {
              "method": "GET",
              "path": "/getContinentByCode",
              "operation": "query ($continentCode: ID!) {\n    continent(code: $continentCode) {\n        code\n        name\n        countries {\n            name\n        }\n    }\n}",
              "variables": {
                "continentCode": "EU"
              }
            },
            {
              "method": "GET",
              "path": "/getCountryByCode",
              "operation": "query ($countryCode: ID!) {\n    country(code: $countryCode) {\n        code\n        name\n    }\n}",
              "variables": {
                "countryCode": "$tyk_context.headers_Code"
              }
            }
          ]
```
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->

issue.title: ignore the field ApiSchema in SQL
issue.body:
<!-- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

## Description
Ignored the ApiSchema column in the migraion process, the issue with gorm is that it was throwing:

```
ERROR: syntax error at or near ")" (SQLSTATE 42601)
[4.724ms] [rows:0] CREATE TABLE "tyk_analytics" ("method" text,"host" text,"path" text,"rawpath" text,"contentlength" bigint,"useragent" text,"day" bigint,"month" bigint,"year" bigint,"hour" bigint,"responsecode" bigint,"apikey" text,"timestamp" timestamptz,"apiversion" text,"api_name" text,"apiid" text,"orgid" text,"oauthid" text,"requesttime" bigint,"rawrequest" text,"rawresponse" text,"ipaddress" text,"geo_country_iso_code" text,"geo_city_geoname_id" bigint,"geo_city_names" text,"geo_location_latitude" decimal,"geo_location_longitude" decimal,"geo_location_time_zone" text,"network_open_connections" bigint,"network_closed_connections" bigint,"network_bytes_in" bigint,"network_bytes_out" bigint,"latency_total" bigint,"latency_upstream" bigint,"tags" text,"alias" text,"trackpath" boolean,"expireAt" timestamptz,"api_schema" )
```

And as you can see, the `api_schema` column didn't have a type, but that column is intended to be ignored, hence updated the gorm tag to ignore it, as per documentation: https://gorm.io/docs/models.html#Field-Level-Permission

The `CI tests / Go 1.16 tests (pull_request)` pipeline is  Failing due:  `"var-naming: struct field ApiSchema should be APISchema" severity="warning"` I cannot change the name of that var here, as it might break the gateway and any other app that imports the analytics struct. We need to work in that lintern and relax the rules and apply them only to new code.

## Related Issue
https://tyktech.atlassian.net/browse/TT-6875

## Motivation and Context
- Fix Pump in SQL
- Fix https://tyktech.atlassian.net/browse/TT-6875

## How This Has Been Tested
- Ran tests in PostgresSQL

## Screenshots (if appropriate)

## Types of changes
<!-- What types of changes does your code introduce? Put an `x` in all the boxes that apply: -->
- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change)

      fork, don't request your `master`!

      *your branch* off *our latest `master`*.

  - [ ] If you've changed APIs, describe what needs to be updated in the documentation.

  - [ ] `go fmt -s`
  - [ ] `go vet`

issue.title: [TT-506] - Self-Healing when hitting 16mb + making aggregation per time setting configurable
issue.body: ## Description When a document size hits 16Mb, we will create a new document with the current timestamp and reduce the aggregation per time configuration by half. Also, users can set an initial aggregation per time, using `analytics_stored_per_minute` in the .conf file, for example: **Default value is set to 60. The scope of the Jira Ticket is to fix this error when using Mongo Aggregate (it also supports Hybrid). SQL Aggregate should work as always and the idea is to make this change on it in another PR** **Use cases:** - If the user sets `analytics_stored_per_minute` = 40, Tyk-Pump will create an initial document on the first request, and will create another document when a new request is received and the current timestamp > last document timestamp + 40 minutes. - If the current document hits 16Mb before 40 minutes have passed, a new document will be created and now, `analytics_stored_per_minute` will equal 20. - If the current document hits 16Mb and `analytics_stored_per_minute` = 1, we can't reduce this setting, so the user will receive an error saying that it was unable to send the new data to the current document. - If `analytics_stored_per_minute` is an odd number, we will round down (i.e: 3 will be converted to 1, not 1.5 or 2) - Every time a document hits 16Mb and we heal it, we will fire an error log telling that there was a problem updating a document, and a warning log saying that we will try to fix it automatically. **Different Behaviors** - If 2 or more pumps are writing data into the same collection, and the collection hits 16Mb, all of them are changing their aggregation time when they try to write data. This is happening because, when they try to write data, they will receive an error. Then, they will check if the error is related to the size of the document. Finally, each pump will activate the self-healing mechanism. - SQL aggregate is working as always. - It is currently working with 3 types of Mongo DBs: Standard Mongo, CosmosDB, DocumentDB. ## Related Issue https://tyktech.atlassian.net/browse/TT-506 ## Motivation and Context It allows users to set an aggregation per time. It also avoids errors when hitting max document size. ## How This Has Been Tested Unit tests were created + manual testing using --demo flag to send multiple fake requests to APIs and send data to Redis to simulate the process. ## Screenshots (if appropriate) ## Types of changes - [x] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue) - [x] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality) - [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change) ## Checklist - [ ] Make sure you are requesting to **pull a topic/feature/bugfix branch** (right side). If pulling from your own fork, don't request your `master`! - [ ] Make sure you are making a pull request against the **`master` branch** (left side). Also, you should start *your branch* off *our latest `master`*. - [ ] My change requires a change to the documentation. - [ ] If you've changed APIs, describe what needs to be updated in the documentation. - [ ] I have updated the documentation accordingly. - [ ] Modules and vendor dependencies have been updated; run `go mod tidy && go mod vendor` - [ ] I have added tests to cover my changes. - [ ] All new and existing tests passed. - [ ] Check your code additions will not fail linting checks: - [ ] `go fmt -s` - [ ] `go vet`

issue.title: TT-3067 - Add ability to use ssl_insecure_skip_verify with Elasticsearch Pump
issue.body:
<!-- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

## Description
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->
Adding users the ability to use an insecure SSL (an autogenerated one), by skipping the SSL verification. We are also allowing the user to select cert and key files.
They can also set the option UseSSL to false in order to skip this process. 
## Related Issue
<!-- This project only accepts pull requests related to open issues -->
<!-- If suggesting a new feature or change, please discuss it in an issue first -->
<!-- If fixing a bug, there should be an issue describing it with steps to reproduce -->
<!-- Please link to the issue here -->
https://tyktech.atlassian.net/browse/TT-3067?atlOrigin=eyJpIjoiZDNjOTRkNTIxZmI0NDU3MDhlMWYzM2ZkYjQ1ZGZlZWYiLCJwIjoiaiJ9
## Motivation and Context
<!-- Why is this change required? What problem does it solve? -->

## How This Has Been Tested
<!-- Please describe in detail how you tested your changes -->
<!-- Include details of your testing environment, and the tests you ran to see how your change affects other areas of
the code, etc. -->
This has been tested by deploying a local Elastic Search with an autogenerated SSL certificate. I have also been using `--demo` flag in the pump to simulate requests.
[This is the tutorial I've used to deploy it with Docker.](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/7.17/configuring-tls-docker.html)

This is the exact command I ran to deploy pump:
`go build && TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_TYPE=elasticsearch TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_INDEXNAME=tyk_analytics TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_ELASTICSEARCHURL=https://localhost:9200 TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_ENABLESNIFFING=false TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_DOCUMENTTYPE=tyk_analytics TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_ROLLINGINDEX=false TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_EXTENDEDSTATISTICS=false TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_VERSION=7 TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_BULKCONFIG_WORKERS=2 TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_BULKCONFIG_FLUSHINTERVAL=60 TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_USESSL=true TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_SSLCERTFILE=/tmp/es01.crt TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_SSLKEYFILE=/tmp/es01.key TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_USERNAME=elastic TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_PASSWORD=password TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_SSLINSECURESKIPVERIFY=true
./tyk-pump --conf ../tyk-develop-env/confs/pump_elastic.conf --demo=634ed5f395014f77d8ec3e49 --demo-api=d79ecd1363784e6c7380cd58f8f44e8d
`

I also deployed an AWS ElasticSearch instance to test this feature using a valid certificate.

## Screenshots (if appropriate)

## Types of changes
<!-- What types of changes does your code introduce? Put an `x` in all the boxes that apply: -->
- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [x] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change)

## Checklist
<!-- Go over all the following points, and put an `x` in all the boxes that apply -->
<!-- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask; we're here to help! -->
- [ ] Make sure you are requesting to **pull a topic/feature/bugfix branch** (right side). If pulling from your own
      fork, don't request your `master`!
- [ ] Make sure you are making a pull request against the **`master` branch** (left side). Also, you should start
      *your branch* off *our latest `master`*.
- [ ] My change requires a change to the documentation.
  - [ ] If you've changed APIs, describe what needs to be updated in the documentation.
- [ ] I have updated the documentation accordingly.
- [ ] Modules and vendor dependencies have been updated; run `go mod tidy && go mod vendor`
- [ ] I have added tests to cover my changes.
- [ ] All new and existing tests passed.
- [ ] Check your code additions will not fail linting checks:
  - [ ] `go fmt -s`
  - [ ] `go vet`

issue.title: [TT-5744] OAS docs updates
issue.body:
The commit completes the work set out in TT-5744.

## Description
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->

- Improve the x-tyk-gateway schema docs generator to group together markdown content without excessive newlines. The paragraphs now stick together, and whitespace output is improved.
- Renamed `Old API definition` into `Tyk native API definition`
- Documented the complete apidef/oas package according to godoc rules, adding missing docs
- Fixed capitalization issues reported by the linter for the most part (Json/JSON, Http/HTTP, Api/API...)

## Related Issue
<!-- This project only accepts pull requests related to open issues -->
<!-- If suggesting a new feature or change, please discuss it in an issue first -->
<!-- If fixing a bug, there should be an issue describing it with steps to reproduce -->
<!-- Please link to the issue here -->

https://tyktech.atlassian.net/browse/TT-5744

## Motivation and Context
<!-- Why is this change required? What problem does it solve? -->

- OAS fields haven't been documented fully for our x-tyk-gateway schema docs,
- Other fields and types haven't been documented according to godoc specs.

## How This Has Been Tested
<!-- Please describe in detail how you tested your changes -->
<!-- Include details of your testing environment, and the tests you ran to see how your change affects other areas of
the code, etc. -->

I've ran this against a custom golangci-lint configuration to ensure that godoc comment patterns are followed. Each exported symbol must have a comment which starts with the symbol name. I've added a significant amount of comments to resolve all the reported godoc issues under apidef/oas.

Additionally, as there are a lot of comments changes/ docs changes to review, I used the following line to ensure I haven't removed anything else by accident - this ignores all the changed/added comments, and displays the remaining code changes for review:

```
git diff *.go | egrep -v '^[+-].*//' | colordiff | less -r
```

# How to review

1. The release target scope of the PR

As the changes are contained within apidef/oas, our minimum target release version is 4.2. Should we split the PR into multiple PRs, it's still going to be 4.2, we're only exaggerating with both splitting the PRs and the CI feedback loops, not to mention each PR increases code review feedback loops too.

2. Review area

What neeeds reviews is:

- code changes not releated to comments,
- documentation changes (generated docs),

**The code changes made are:**

- capitalization fixes for various fields for common acronyms (Http to HTTP and similar),
- made two fields non-public (used in tests),
- renamed a 'version' package into 'pkgver' to make it clearer we don't shadow the value over the package name,
- the improvements to the xtyk docs generator outlined above

To only view the code changes, check out the branch locally, go to `apidef/oas` and issue:

```
git diff -w HEAD~9 *.go | \
egrep -v '^[+-].*//' | \
egrep '^[+-]' | \
grep -v '^---' | grep -v '^+++' | \
perl -p -e 's/^([+-]).+/$1/g' | \
sort | uniq -c
```

This returns `+256` and `-162`. The changes are even smaller considering the capitalization fixes add up, but that too could be brought down with git difftool and case-insensitive diffs. The xdoc changes are `+96` and `-53` (change wildcard from `*.go` to `xtyk_*.go`. To view the differences themselves and not just the statistics for additions/removals, we have:

```
git diff -w HEAD~9 *.go | \
egrep -v '^[+-].*//' | \
grep -v '^+$' | \
colordiff | \
less -r
```

This will:

- diff only *.go files (not the .md generated one),
- ignore added or removed comments lines from the diff,
- ignore empty lines (added whitespace)
- print a colorized diff with colordiff
- invoke less to scroll through the changes

If there's an issue you want to raise up, this will give you the file/line information to do that.

**Documentation review**

As explained above, this PR mostly adds documentation. Rather than reviewing the code where the documentation is added, the final result from that should be reviewed. The documentation review should happen over the difference between these two outputs:

- New docs: https://github.com/TykTechnologies/tyk/blob/fix/tt-5744/improve-oas-docs-and-generator/apidef/oas/schema/x-tyk-gateway.md
- Existing docs: https://github.com/TykTechnologies/tyk/blob/master/apidef/oas/schema/x-tyk-gateway.md

There is little sense of reviewing the actual code `//` comments, what matters is the generated output, and if we need to change wording there (spell check, phrasing, etc.). The comments about formatting godoc comments have been addressed in the PR, and we try to keep consistency (Fill, ExtractTo, godoc comments should be full sentences).

The PR adds godoc comments where previously omitted. If required, grab the golangci-lint config from this link here: [private repo](https://github.com/TykTechnologies/titpetric/blob/main/dev/.golangci.yml) and run with `golangci-lint --enable-all run .` from the apidef/oas folder. This is how I verified we follow godoc standards, not by hand, but by tooling.

issue.title: [TT-6927] Improving DX with make lint, add faillint, PR template update
issue.body:
Essentially this PR improves a number of things in regards to the developer experience. There are a number of scenarios which hurt our delivery due to time wasted on CI and a very long feedback loop, and often actions which should be first-order development tasks before opening a PR.
<!-- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

## Description
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->

- Added `make lint`, updated CI to use it. People don't run shit on local, I hope this will change this.
- Added `goimports` and `gofmt` as part of `make lint` (make people run it on local)
- Added .faillint to blacklist `fmt.Print*` (use our /log pkg) and `net/http.Get` (no timeouts).
- Added goenv `.go-version`, we build against 1.16 - facilitate people actually using 1.16 with goenv.
- Updated PR template (removed unused/obsolete checklists) - most of them are handled in CI, we don't need to double-blind the inputs. I've left only the essential ones that apply.
- If a new field is added into the /config/config.go, usually a separate linter surfaces an issue in the CI. The linter is now added into `make lint`.
- Decreased verbosity on failing tests, scrolling through 100 pages of content has no value. This PR removes spam both in github comments and emails.

## Related Issue
<!-- This project only accepts pull requests related to open issues -->
<!-- If suggesting a new feature or change, please discuss it in an issue first -->
<!-- If fixing a bug, there should be an issue describing it with steps to reproduce -->
<!-- Please link to the issue here -->

As of yet - none. This falls under maintenance and CI, DX, and should only be merged to the develop branch, or particularly the latest release branch. Backporting it isn't required as it fixes no immediate issues, only improves ongoing development.

## Motivation and Context

Happyness.
<!-- Why is this change required? What problem does it solve? -->

## How This Has Been Tested

Lots of `make lint` invocations. GH actions have been left to CI.

<!-- Please describe in detail how you tested your changes -->
<!-- Include details of your testing environment, and the tests you ran to see how your change affects other areas of
the code, etc. -->

## Screenshots (if appropriate)

## Types of changes
<!-- What types of changes does your code introduce? Put an `x` in all the boxes that apply: -->
- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change)
- [x] Refactoring or add test (improvements in base code or adds test coverage to functionality)

## Checklist

- [x] I ensured that the documentation is up to date

issue.title: [TT-6927] Improving DX with make lint, add faillint, PR template update
issue.body:
Essentially this PR improves a number of things in regards to the developer experience. There are a number of scenarios which hurt our delivery due to time wasted on CI and a very long feedback loop, and often actions which should be first-order development tasks before opening a PR.
<!-- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

## Description
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->

- Added `make lint`, updated CI to use it. People don't run shit on local, I hope this will change this.
- Added `goimports` and `gofmt` as part of `make lint` (make people run it on local)
- Added .faillint to blacklist `fmt.Print*` (use our /log pkg) and `net/http.Get` (no timeouts).
- Added goenv `.go-version`, we build against 1.16 - facilitate people actually using 1.16 with goenv.
- Updated PR template (removed unused/obsolete checklists) - most of them are handled in CI, we don't need to double-blind the inputs. I've left only the essential ones that apply.
- If a new field is added into the /config/config.go, usually a separate linter surfaces an issue in the CI. The linter is now added into `make lint`.
- Decreased verbosity on failing tests, scrolling through 100 pages of content has no value. This PR removes spam both in github comments and emails.

Happyness.

issue.title: [TT-6575] feat: persisted queries
issue.body:
<!-- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

## Description
This PR adds a new middleware `PersistGraphQLOperationMiddleware` by @asoorm. This middleware allows the exposing graphql endpoints as Rest endpoints vie extended paths. It also allows using variables from the context variables, path or other tyk template variables. 
[Link to demo video](https://www.loom.com/share/684e1e9902054d978897e24d7824dec5)
Sample Spec:
```.json
"extended_paths": {
          "persist_graphql": [
            {
              "method": "GET",
              "path": "/getContinentByCode",
              "operation": "query ($continentCode: ID!) {\n    continent(code: $continentCode) {\n        code\n        name\n        countries {\n            name\n        }\n    }\n}",
              "variables": {
                "continentCode": "EU"
              }
            },
            {
              "method": "GET",
              "path": "/getCountryByCode",
              "operation": "query ($countryCode: ID!) {\n    country(code: $countryCode) {\n        code\n        name\n    }\n}",
              "variables": {
                "countryCode": "$tyk_context.headers_Code"
              }
            }
          ]
```
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->

issue.title: ignore the field ApiSchema in SQL
issue.body:
<!-- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

## Description
Ignored the ApiSchema column in the migraion process, the issue with gorm is that it was throwing:

```
ERROR: syntax error at or near ")" (SQLSTATE 42601)
[4.724ms] [rows:0] CREATE TABLE "tyk_analytics" ("method" text,"host" text,"path" text,"rawpath" text,"contentlength" bigint,"useragent" text,"day" bigint,"month" bigint,"year" bigint,"hour" bigint,"responsecode" bigint,"apikey" text,"timestamp" timestamptz,"apiversion" text,"api_name" text,"apiid" text,"orgid" text,"oauthid" text,"requesttime" bigint,"rawrequest" text,"rawresponse" text,"ipaddress" text,"geo_country_iso_code" text,"geo_city_geoname_id" bigint,"geo_city_names" text,"geo_location_latitude" decimal,"geo_location_longitude" decimal,"geo_location_time_zone" text,"network_open_connections" bigint,"network_closed_connections" bigint,"network_bytes_in" bigint,"network_bytes_out" bigint,"latency_total" bigint,"latency_upstream" bigint,"tags" text,"alias" text,"trackpath" boolean,"expireAt" timestamptz,"api_schema" )
```

And as you can see, the `api_schema` column didn't have a type, but that column is intended to be ignored, hence updated the gorm tag to ignore it, as per documentation: https://gorm.io/docs/models.html#Field-Level-Permission

The `CI tests / Go 1.16 tests (pull_request)` pipeline is  Failing due:  `"var-naming: struct field ApiSchema should be APISchema" severity="warning"` I cannot change the name of that var here, as it might break the gateway and any other app that imports the analytics struct. We need to work in that lintern and relax the rules and apply them only to new code.

## Related Issue
https://tyktech.atlassian.net/browse/TT-6875

## Motivation and Context
- Fix Pump in SQL
- Fix https://tyktech.atlassian.net/browse/TT-6875

## How This Has Been Tested
- Ran tests in PostgresSQL

## Screenshots (if appropriate)

## Types of changes
<!-- What types of changes does your code introduce? Put an `x` in all the boxes that apply: -->
- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)

issue.title: [TT-506] - Self-Healing when hitting 16mb + making aggregation per time setting configurable
issue.body: ## Description When a document size hits 16Mb, we will create a new document with the current timestamp and reduce the aggregation per time configuration by half. Also, users can set an initial aggregation per time, using `analytics_stored_per_minute` in the .conf file, for example: **Default value is set to 60. The scope of the Jira Ticket is to fix this error when using Mongo Aggregate (it also supports Hybrid). SQL Aggregate should work as always and the idea is to make this change on it in another PR** **Use cases:** - If the user sets `analytics_stored_per_minute` = 40, Tyk-Pump will create an initial document on the first request, and will create another document when a new request is received and the current timestamp > last document timestamp + 40 minutes. - If the current document hits 16Mb before 40 minutes have passed, a new document will be created and now, `analytics_stored_per_minute` will equal 20. - If the current document hits 16Mb and `analytics_stored_per_minute` = 1, we can't reduce this setting, so the user will receive an error saying that it was unable to send the new data to the current document. - If `analytics_stored_per_minute` is an odd number, we will round down (i.e: 3 will be converted to 1, not 1.5 or 2) - Every time a document hits 16Mb and we heal it, we will fire an error log telling that there was a problem updating a document, and a warning log saying that we will try to fix it automatically. **Different Behaviors** - If 2 or more pumps are writing data into the same collection, and the collection hits 16Mb, all of them are changing their aggregation time when they try to write data. This is happening because, when they try to write data, they will receive an error. Then, they will check if the error is related to the size of the document. Finally, each pump will activate the self-healing mechanism. - SQL aggregate is working as always. - It is currently working with 3 types of Mongo DBs: Standard Mongo, CosmosDB, DocumentDB. ## Related Issue https://tyktech.atlassian.net/browse/TT-506 ## Motivation and Context It allows users to set an aggregation per time. It also avoids errors when hitting max document size. ## How This Has Been Tested Unit tests were created + manual testing using --demo flag to send multiple fake requests to APIs and send data to Redis to simulate the process. ## Screenshots (if appropriate) ## Types of changes - [x] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue) - [x] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality) - [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change) ## Checklist - [ ] Make sure you are requesting to **pull a topic/feature/bugfix branch** (right side). If pulling from your own fork, don't request your `master`! - [ ] Make sure you are making a pull request against the **`master` branch** (left side). Also, you should start *your branch* off *our latest `master`*. - [ ] My change requires a change to the documentation. - [ ] If you've changed APIs, describe what needs to be updated in the documentation. - [ ] I have updated the documentation accordingly. - [ ] Modules and vendor dependencies have been updated; run `go mod tidy && go mod vendor` - [ ] I have added tests to cover my changes. - [ ] All new and existing tests passed. - [ ] Check your code additions will not fail linting checks: - [ ] `go fmt -s` - [ ] `go vet`

issue.title: TT-3067 - Add ability to use ssl_insecure_skip_verify with Elasticsearch Pump
issue.body:
<!-- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

## Description
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->
Adding users the ability to use an insecure SSL (an autogenerated one), by skipping the SSL verification. We are also allowing the user to select cert and key files.
They can also set the option UseSSL to false in order to skip this process. 
## Related Issue
<!-- This project only accepts pull requests related to open issues -->
<!-- If suggesting a new feature or change, please discuss it in an issue first -->
<!-- If fixing a bug, there should be an issue describing it with steps to reproduce -->
<!-- Please link to the issue here -->
https://tyktech.atlassian.net/browse/TT-3067?atlOrigin=eyJpIjoiZDNjOTRkNTIxZmI0NDU3MDhlMWYzM2ZkYjQ1ZGZlZWYiLCJwIjoiaiJ9
## Motivation and Context
<!-- Why is this change required? What problem does it solve? -->

## How This Has Been Tested
<!-- Please describe in detail how you tested your changes -->
<!-- Include details of your testing environment, and the tests you ran to see how your change affects other areas of
the code, etc. -->
This has been tested by deploying a local Elastic Search with an autogenerated SSL certificate. I have also been using `--demo` flag in the pump to simulate requests.
[This is the tutorial I've used to deploy it with Docker.](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/7.17/configuring-tls-docker.html)

This is the exact command I ran to deploy pump:
`go build && TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_TYPE=elasticsearch TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_INDEXNAME=tyk_analytics TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_ELASTICSEARCHURL=https://localhost:9200 TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_ENABLESNIFFING=false TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_DOCUMENTTYPE=tyk_analytics TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_ROLLINGINDEX=false TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_EXTENDEDSTATISTICS=false TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_VERSION=7 TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_BULKCONFIG_WORKERS=2 TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_BULKCONFIG_FLUSHINTERVAL=60 TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_USESSL=true TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_SSLCERTFILE=/tmp/es01.crt TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_SSLKEYFILE=/tmp/es01.key TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_USERNAME=elastic TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_PASSWORD=password TYK_PMP_PUMPS_ELASTICSEARCH_META_SSLINSECURESKIPVERIFY=true
./tyk-pump --conf ../tyk-develop-env/confs/pump_elastic.conf --demo=634ed5f395014f77d8ec3e49 --demo-api=d79ecd1363784e6c7380cd58f8f44e8d
`

I also deployed an AWS ElasticSearch instance to test this feature using a valid certificate.

## Screenshots (if appropriate)

issue.title: [TT-5744] OAS docs updates
issue.body:
The commit completes the work set out in TT-5744.

## Description
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->

- Improve the x-tyk-gateway schema docs generator to group together markdown content without excessive newlines. The paragraphs now stick together, and whitespace output is improved.
- Renamed `Old API definition` into `Tyk native API definition`
- Documented the complete apidef/oas package according to godoc rules, adding missing docs
- Fixed capitalization issues reported by the linter for the most part (Json/JSON, Http/HTTP, Api/API...)

## Related Issue
<!-- This project only accepts pull requests related to open issues -->
<!-- If suggesting a new feature or change, please discuss it in an issue first -->
<!-- If fixing a bug, there should be an issue describing it with steps to reproduce -->
<!-- Please link to the issue here -->

https://tyktech.atlassian.net/browse/TT-5744

## Motivation and Context
<!-- Why is this change required? What problem does it solve? -->

- OAS fields haven't been documented fully for our x-tyk-gateway schema docs,
- Other fields and types haven't been documented according to godoc specs.

## How This Has Been Tested
<!-- Please describe in detail how you tested your changes -->
<!-- Include details of your testing environment, and the tests you ran to see how your change affects other areas of
the code, etc. -->

I've ran this against a custom golangci-lint configuration to ensure that godoc comment patterns are followed. Each exported symbol must have a comment which starts with the symbol name. I've added a significant amount of comments to resolve all the reported godoc issues under apidef/oas.

Additionally, as there are a lot of comments changes/ docs changes to review, I used the following line to ensure I haven't removed anything else by accident - this ignores all the changed/added comments, and displays the remaining code changes for review:

```
git diff *.go | egrep -v '^[+-].*//' | colordiff | less -r
```

# How to review

1. The release target scope of the PR

As the changes are contained within apidef/oas, our minimum target release version is 4.2. Should we split the PR into multiple PRs, it's still going to be 4.2, we're only exaggerating with both splitting the PRs and the CI feedback loops, not to mention each PR increases code review feedback loops too.

2. Review area

What neeeds reviews is:

- code changes not releated to comments,
- documentation changes (generated docs),

**The code changes made are:**

- capitalization fixes for various fields for common acronyms (Http to HTTP and similar),
- made two fields non-public (used in tests),
- renamed a 'version' package into 'pkgver' to make it clearer we don't shadow the value over the package name,
- the improvements to the xtyk docs generator outlined above

To only view the code changes, check out the branch locally, go to `apidef/oas` and issue:

```
git diff -w HEAD~9 *.go | \
egrep -v '^[+-].*//' | \
egrep '^[+-]' | \
grep -v '^---' | grep -v '^+++' | \
perl -p -e 's/^([+-]).+/$1/g' | \
sort | uniq -c
```

This returns `+256` and `-162`. The changes are even smaller considering the capitalization fixes add up, but that too could be brought down with git difftool and case-insensitive diffs. The xdoc changes are `+96` and `-53` (change wildcard from `*.go` to `xtyk_*.go`. To view the differences themselves and not just the statistics for additions/removals, we have:

```
git diff -w HEAD~9 *.go | \
egrep -v '^[+-].*//' | \
grep -v '^+$' | \
colordiff | \
less -r
```

This will:

- diff only *.go files (not the .md generated one),
- ignore added or removed comments lines from the diff,
- ignore empty lines (added whitespace)
- print a colorized diff with colordiff
- invoke less to scroll through the changes

If there's an issue you want to raise up, this will give you the file/line information to do that.

**Documentation review**

As explained above, this PR mostly adds documentation. Rather than reviewing the code where the documentation is added, the final result from that should be reviewed. The documentation review should happen over the difference between these two outputs:

- New docs: https://github.com/TykTechnologies/tyk/blob/fix/tt-5744/improve-oas-docs-and-generator/apidef/oas/schema/x-tyk-gateway.md
- Existing docs: https://github.com/TykTechnologies/tyk/blob/master/apidef/oas/schema/x-tyk-gateway.md

There is little sense of reviewing the actual code `//` comments, what matters is the generated output, and if we need to change wording there (spell check, phrasing, etc.). The comments about formatting godoc comments have been addressed in the PR, and we try to keep consistency (Fill, ExtractTo, godoc comments should be full sentences).

The PR adds godoc comments where previously omitted. If required, grab the golangci-lint config from this link here: [private repo](https://github.com/TykTechnologies/titpetric/blob/main/dev/.golangci.yml) and run with `golangci-lint --enable-all run .` from the apidef/oas folder. This is how I verified we follow godoc standards, not by hand, but by tooling.

## Screenshots (if appropriate)

## Types of changes
<!-- What types of changes does your code introduce? Put an `x` in all the boxes that apply: -->
- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change)
- [x] Refactoring or add test (improvements in base code or adds test coverage to functionality)

## Checklist
<!-- Go over all the following points, and put an `x` in all the boxes that apply -->
<!-- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask; we're here to help! -->
- [ ] Make sure you are requesting to **pull a topic/feature/bugfix branch** (right side). If pulling from your own
      fork, don't request your `master`!
- [ ] Make sure you are making a pull request against the **`master` branch** (left side). Also, you should start
      *your branch* off *our latest `master`*.
- [ ] My change requires a change to the documentation.
  - [ ] If you've changed APIs, describe what needs to be updated in the documentation.
  - [ ] If new config option added, ensure that it can be set via ENV variable
- [ ] I have updated the documentation accordingly.
- [ ] Modules and vendor dependencies have been updated; run `go mod tidy && go mod vendor`
- [ ] When updating library version must provide reason/explanation for this update.
- [ ] I have added tests to cover my changes.
- [ ] All new and existing tests passed.
- [ ] Check your code additions will not fail linting checks:
  - [ ] `go fmt -s`
  - [ ] `go vet`

issue.title: [TT-6927] Improving DX with make lint, add faillint, PR template update
issue.body:
Essentially this PR improves a number of things in regards to the developer experience. There are a number of scenarios which hurt our delivery due to time wasted on CI and a very long feedback loop, and often actions which should be first-order development tasks before opening a PR.
<!-- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

## Description
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->

- Added `make lint`, updated CI to use it. People don't run shit on local, I hope this will change this.
- Added `goimports` and `gofmt` as part of `make lint` (make people run it on local)
- Added .faillint to blacklist `fmt.Print*` (use our /log pkg) and `net/http.Get` (no timeouts).
- Added goenv `.go-version`, we build against 1.16 - facilitate people actually using 1.16 with goenv.
- Updated PR template (removed unused/obsolete checklists) - most of them are handled in CI, we don't need to double-blind the inputs. I've left only the essential ones that apply.
- If a new field is added into the /config/config.go, usually a separate linter surfaces an issue in the CI. The linter is now added into `make lint`.
- Decreased verbosity on failing tests, scrolling through 100 pages of content has no value. This PR removes spam both in github comments and emails.

issue.title: [TT-6575] feat: persisted queries
issue.body:
<!-- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

## Description
This PR adds a new middleware `PersistGraphQLOperationMiddleware` by @asoorm. This middleware allows the exposing graphql endpoints as Rest endpoints vie extended paths. It also allows using variables from the context variables, path or other tyk template variables. 
[Link to demo video](https://www.loom.com/share/684e1e9902054d978897e24d7824dec5)
Sample Spec:
```.json
"extended_paths": {
          "persist_graphql": [
            {
              "method": "GET",
              "path": "/getContinentByCode",
              "operation": "query ($continentCode: ID!) {\n    continent(code: $continentCode) {\n        code\n        name\n        countries {\n            name\n        }\n    }\n}",
              "variables": {
                "continentCode": "EU"
              }
            },
            {
              "method": "GET",
              "path": "/getCountryByCode",
              "operation": "query ($countryCode: ID!) {\n    country(code: $countryCode) {\n        code\n        name\n    }\n}",
              "variables": {
                "countryCode": "$tyk_context.headers_Code"
              }
            }
          ]
```
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->

issue.title: ignore the field ApiSchema in SQL
issue.body:
<!-- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

## Description
Ignored the ApiSchema column in the migraion process, the issue with gorm is that it was throwing:

```
ERROR: syntax error at or near ")" (SQLSTATE 42601)
[4.724ms] [rows:0] CREATE TABLE "tyk_analytics" ("method" text,"host" text,"path" text,"rawpath" text,"contentlength" bigint,"useragent" text,"day" bigint,"month" bigint,"year" bigint,"hour" bigint,"responsecode" bigint,"apikey" text,"timestamp" timestamptz,"apiversion" text,"api_name" text,"apiid" text,"orgid" text,"oauthid" text,"requesttime" bigint,"rawrequest" text,"rawresponse" text,"ipaddress" text,"geo_country_iso_code" text,"geo_city_geoname_id" bigint,"geo_city_names" text,"geo_location_latitude" decimal,"geo_location_longitude" decimal,"geo_location_time_zone" text,"network_open_connections" bigint,"network_closed_connections" bigint,"network_bytes_in" bigint,"network_bytes_out" bigint,"latency_total" bigint,"latency_upstream" bigint,"tags" text,"alias" text,"trackpath" boolean,"expireAt" timestamptz,"api_schema" )
```

And as you can see, the `api_schema` column didn't have a type, but that column is intended to be ignored, hence updated the gorm tag to ignore it, as per documentation: https://gorm.io/docs/models.html#Field-Level-Permission

The `CI tests / Go 1.16 tests (pull_request)` pipeline is  Failing due:  `"var-naming: struct field ApiSchema should be APISchema" severity="warning"` I cannot change the name of that var here, as it might break the gateway and any other app that imports the analytics struct. We need to work in that lintern and relax the rules and apply them only to new code.

## Related Issue
https://tyktech.atlassian.net/browse/TT-6875

## Motivation and Context
- Fix Pump in SQL
- Fix https://tyktech.atlassian.net/browse/TT-6875

## How This Has Been Tested
- Ran tests in PostgresSQL

## Screenshots (if appropriate)

## Types of changes
<!-- What types of changes does your code introduce? Put an `x` in all the boxes that apply: -->
- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)

      *your branch* off *our latest `master`*.

  - [ ] `go fmt -s`
